What should I do if I have previously launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this release?

If you have previously launched VRSCTEST from a version prior to this release, you need to delete specific directories on your system before running the new update. The directories to delete vary depending on your operating system:

* On Linux, delete `~/.komodo/vrsctest`.
* On MacOS, delete `⁨Users⁩/⁨{YourUserName}/⁨Library⁩/⁨Application Support⁩/⁨Komodo/vrsctest`.
* On Windows, delete `"%APPDATA%"\Komodo\VRSCTEST`.

Why might antivirus software like Avast or Kaspersky flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP"?

Antivirus software like Avast or Kaspersky might flag the software as "not-a-virus" or "PUP" because it includes mining software, which could potentially be installed by a third party to exploit your PC. These warnings are false positives, and you can find more information about them in the provided resources.
